_header: The fruitful sentence and the noble works
Note:
Cf. 6776; also Church (1946)
XChurch, Margaret. “The First English Pattern Poems.” PMLA 6 (1946): 636-50, 636-50; Berdan (1920)
XBerdan, John M. Early Tudor Poetry, 1485-1547. New York: Macmillan, 1920, 90.
_description: Stephen Hawes, The Conuersion of Swerers — forty-six stanzas rhyme royal (including 6776 and a concluding envoy) and short-line emblem verses (‘See / Me / be kynde’).
